summary: An email from an unidentified author to an FBI Special Agent, warning that Jeffrey Epstein will likely flee the country after completing house arrest in July 2010. The author claims Epstein has $2 billion in assets and will continue to abuse underage girls abroad. The email urges the FBI to contact attorney Robert Josefsberg to speak with a key victim/witness in Australia (Jane Doe 102) who was trafficked on Epstein's plane and performed sexual activities with powerful figures.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a wealthy individual with $2 billion in assets who will likely flee the US after house arrest to continue damaging underage girls in other countries.

persons.name: Robert Josefsberg
persons.context: An attorney in Miami who the FBI is urged to contact in order to speak with a victim/witness in Australia.

connections.description: Epstein is accused of trafficking and prostituting Jane Doe 102, who was on his plane many times performing sexual activities for him and others.
The email implies Robert Josefsberg is or was an attorney for Jane Doe 102, as the FBI is urged to contact him to speak with her.

events.title: Epstein's House Arrest Completion
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is scheduled to complete his house arrest, after which the author predicts he will leave the US for good.

events.title: Settlement with Jane Doe 102
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein settled with Jane Doe 102 (victim in Australia) for what the author describes as 'pennies' compared to his wealth, and she is under a gag order.

locations: 450 Golden Gate Ave., 13th floor San Francisco CA 94102
keyFacts: The author warns that Jeffrey Epstein, with $2 billion in assets, will likely flee the US permanently after completing house arrest on July 21, 2010, to continue abusing underage girls in other countries.

A key victim/witness, Jane Doe 102 (case #09-80656), lives in Australia; she was trafficked on Epstein's plane and performed sexual activities with heads of state, businessmen, royalty, politicians, and celebrities.
The FBI is urged to contact Miami attorney Robert Josefsberg as a first step to speak with Jane Doe 102 if they are serious about arresting Epstein on child sex trafficking charges.
Epstein settled with Jane Doe 102 in 2009 for a relatively small amount, and she is subject to a gag order.
